intro: Paronychia weberbaueri, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in spring and are pollinated by insects. Paronychia weberbaueri is often cultivated in xeriscapes due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
